- Also, while atomic operators are nice, it‚Äôd be MUCH better if JavaScript required that regex engines NEVER backtracked unless the regex requires it (e.g., by using a backreference).
- This would imply that they‚Äôd need to implement a Deterministic Finite Automata (DFA) as well as an NFA, and use the DFA unless the user specifically required something that cannot be implemented without backtracking like a backreference (at which point you use the NFA).
